result.execSummary:
The defendant Ramses Jomar Crespo-Negron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED pending review on May 20, 2016.
**07/22/16-Judge Jeffrey A. Kremers**
It is ordered that a commitment be issued forthwith directing the Sheriff of Milwaukee County to take the said Defendant into custody to spend 60 days straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for said Defendant's non-compliance with the aforementioned condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramses Jomar Crespo-Negron

records.addlTxt: 60 days condition time ordered for non-compliance.

Defendant Ramses Jomar Crespo-Negron not in court.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The defendant is in absconder status.  The Court lifted the stay on the balance of the conditional time of 60 days and ordered a commitment to issue.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.

At the request of the agent, case is adjourned for another probation review hearing in Branch 36 on 07/22/2016 at 01:30 p.m.
cab

Defendant Ramses Jomar Crespo-Negron in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Ramses Jomar Crespo-Negron in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Judge Kremers is hearing this case for Judge Havas, who is in trial.
.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
.
As to counts 1 and 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 3:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered the case dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing proceeded...
.
As to count 1:
  Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement by: 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Correction, concurrent with the sentence he is currently serving,  with 44 days credit.
Court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all costs and surcharges as to this count.

As to count 2:
  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time,  with credit for -0- days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
Jury trial date of 03/16/16 vacated.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
